creator: wsmwk

content:
I guess you have a firewall issue, or an antivirus issue.

The standard diagnostic is to restart your operating system in safe mode with networking. This disables anti virus and software firewalls and should offer a glimpse that may determine if that is the root issue if Thunderbird can do those things in safe mode with networking.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
augz_06 said
The new Thunderbird download took place today. (115.2.0) We're not yet offering an automated update from version 102. How did you get the 115 download?

augz_06 said
Every time I try to use the app on my windows, the app freezes / crashes straight away and I can't use it.

You are on Windows 10.

  • Please start *Windows* in safe mode with networking enabled https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/12376/windows-10-start-your-pc-in-safe-mode
  • Still in Windows safe mode, start Thunderbird in Troubleshoot mode https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird

Does problem go away?

augz_06 said
I'll try and download an older version, but wondering if anyone has a solution?

Not recommended - it's often painful
creator: wsmwk

content: Fixed it! Another posted question mentioned the utility for purging visited URLs, and once that was done the link turned blue again. Shouldn't happen again now that I'm set up not to remember visited sites.
